# Peddler

> Ruby interface to Amazon's Selling Partner API (SP-API)

## Getting Started

```ruby
# Install
gem install peddler

# Set credentials
export LWA_CLIENT_ID=<YOUR_CLIENT_ID>
export LWA_CLIENT_SECRET=<YOUR_CLIENT_SECRET>

# Get access token
require "peddler"
response = Peddler::LWA.request(refresh_token: "<REFRESH_TOKEN>")
access_token = response.parse.access_token

# Make first API call
api = Peddler.orders.new("us-east-1", access_token)
response = api.get_orders(
  marketplaceIds: ["ATVPDKIKX0DER"],
  createdAfter: "2024-01-01T00:00:00Z"
)
orders = response.parse.payload.orders
```

## Source Code

- [lib/peddler/](lib/peddler/) - Core implementation with YARD docs
- [sig/peddler/](sig/peddler/) - RBS type signatures
- [test/peddler/apis/](test/peddler/apis/) - Integration tests with VCR cassettes

## Amazon SP-API

- [API Models](https://github.com/amzn/selling-partner-api-models) - OpenAPI specs and schemas
- [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/amzn/selling-partner-api-models/issues) - Troubleshooting, workarounds, Amazon responses
- [Official Documentation](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/) - Use cases, guides, registration
